newsitem.title: USA: Midwest Express April load factor off.
newsitem.headline: Midwest Express April load factor off.

text.p: Midwest Express Holdings Inc said the passenger load factor for Midwest Express Airlines fell 1.6 points to 63.5 percent from a 65.1 percent a year ago, and for its Skyway Airlines dropped 1.7 points to 43.7 percent from 45.4 percent.

"Load factor dipped slightly due to increased capacity from the new service we've added over the past year," Timothy Hoeksema, chairman, said in a statement. "But as I've indicated in the past, much of that service is in higher yield, lower load factor markets."

The company said Midwest Express' revenue passenger miles in the month rose 11.1 percent to 111.8 million from 100.6 million a year ago. Skyway's revenue passenger miles were up 0.2 percent to 6.0 million.
Available seat miles in April rose 13.8 percent to 175.9 million for Midwest Express and increased 4.2 percent to 13.7 million for Skyway Airlines.
Midwest Expresss recently introduced non-stop service between Kansas City and New York's LaGuardia Airline, which will be reflected in the report for May traffic.
